title: Civic Engagement - An International Multi-level Analysis
abstractText:
Civic Engagement - An International Multi-level Analysis The aims of the project are to develop cross-national and intra-national measures of civic engagement and to identify and understand more fully what leads to civic engagement. The programme of research includes: a review of how civic engagement has been conceptualised and measured in national and international surveys; a multi-level analysis of individual levels of civic engagement and the impact of contextual issues at the local and national level such as the socio-economic profile of an area, political culture and policy issues; finally detailed country case studies will be conducted in order to explore in detail the policy context and the institutional arrangements for civic engagement.

The research will make a valuable contribution to the international evidence base and policy debates regarding civic engagement and democratic renewal and inform the development of effective civic engagement strategies. Dr. Kingsley Purdam is a Research Fellow at CCSR at the University of Manchester. Dr. Mark Tranmer is a Lecturer in Social Statistics at CCSR.
